quote: I raced in the half series and managed to place 3rd in the 60+ woman category -- right behind fellow BaseCamp Explore Team member Lynn Botelho. The race started with perfect weather after a long hot and humid streak in the east.

I was in the lead to about 3 miles out when Beth caught up to me at the entrance to the single track. We actually crashed. She took off with me on the ground. I do love descents and tough terrain. ðŸ˜³ Caught up and passed her in a mud pit.

I was sick in bed for a week and then I had a 16 days holiday in the UK. So with 2 weeks to prep, I did everything I knew how. Good food; no drink. Mini training camp over a long weekend. Good sleep. Solid work outs. Good rest.

Since attending the BaseCamp gravel camp in Michaux Forest back in October, I've really wanted to get to one of the races there... I was with the front of the race, until I realized I overspent and was unable to follow the front 5. I dialed things back and paced my effort.

A sidewall slash on my rear tire ended my ride. I didn't bring a tube and nothing was plugging that, though I tried for about 4 minutes. Being so close to the finish still in the top of the field was agonizing... so I picked up my bike and ran.
